title: CLAUDE.md
text: watcher R package provides R bindings libfswatch, cross-platform file system monitoring library. enables asynchronous background monitoring filesystem changes using optimal event-driven APIs platform (ReadDirectoryChangesW Windows, FSEvents macOS, inotify Linux, kqueue BSD, File Events Notification Solaris/Illumos).

title: CLAUDE.md
text: R Layer (R/watch.R): - watcher(): Factory function creates Watcher R6 object - Watcher: R6 class wraps C interface methods: - $start(): Start background monitoring - $stop(): Stop monitoring - $is_running(): Check monitor status - $get_path(): Get watched path(s) - R6 class maintains reference C-level FSW_HANDLE via external pointer C Layer (src/): - watcher.c: Core implementation three main entry points: - watcher_create(): Initialize fswatch session paths, callback, latency - watcher_start_monitor(): Spawn detached pthread running fsw_start_monitor() - watcher_stop_monitor(): Stop monitoring thread - init.c: R package initialization : - Initializes libfswatch library - Obtains execLaterNative2 ‘later’ package async callbacks - Registers C callable methods - watcher.h: Header file defining structures function signatures Callback Mechanism: - File events trigger process_events() callback C - Events bundled path passed R via ‘later’ package’s execLaterNative2 - R callbacks execute R idle later::run_now() called - callback provided, events printed stdout

title: CLAUDE.md
text: Configure Scripts: - configure (Linux/macOS): Detects system-installed libfswatch standard locations (/usr/local, /usr, homebrew paths). found, compiles bundled libfswatch (v1.19.0-dev) using cmake. Handles special cases like ARM atomic operations. - configure.win (Windows non-UCRT): Compiles libfswatch source x64 i386 architectures - configure.ucrt (Windows UCRT): Simplified version modern Windows R builds - scripts generate src/Makevars appropriate compiler flags Key Dependencies: - libfswatch (bundled source src/fswatch/) - cmake (required compiling libfswatch source) - pthread (background monitoring thread) - ‘later’ R package (async callback execution)

title: Watch the File System for Changes
text: Create ‘Watcher’ using watcher::watcher(). default watch current working directory recursively write events stdout. Set callback argument run R function, rlang-style formula, every time file changes: Uses ‘later’ package execute callback R idle top level, whenever later::run_now() called, instance automatically Shiny’s event loop. Function called back character vector paths files changed.
code: library(watcher) dir <- file.path(tempdir(), "watcher-example") dir.create(dir)  w <- watcher(dir, callback = ~print(.x), latency = 0.5) w #> <Watcher> #>   Public: #>     get_path: function ()  #>     initialize: function (path, callback, latency)  #>     is_running: function ()  #>     start: function ()  #>     stop: function ()  #>   Private: #>     path: /var/folders/38/lgkw9s3d5tn626g4z2r11bzm0000gp/T//RtmpFm ... #>     running: FALSE #>     watch: externalptr w$start()  file.create(file.path(dir, "newfile")) #> [1] TRUE file.create(file.path(dir, "anotherfile")) #> [1] TRUE later::run_now(1) #> [1] "/private/var/folders/38/lgkw9s3d5tn626g4z2r11bzm0000gp/T/RtmpFmlhtZ/watcher-example"             #> [2] "/private/var/folders/38/lgkw9s3d5tn626g4z2r11bzm0000gp/T/RtmpFmlhtZ/watcher-example/newfile"     #> [3] "/private/var/folders/38/lgkw9s3d5tn626g4z2r11bzm0000gp/T/RtmpFmlhtZ/watcher-example/anotherfile"  newfile <- file(file.path(dir, "newfile"), open = "r+") cat("hello", file = newfile) close(newfile) later::run_now(1) #> [1] "/private/var/folders/38/lgkw9s3d5tn626g4z2r11bzm0000gp/T/RtmpFmlhtZ/watcher-example/newfile"  file.remove(file.path(dir, "newfile")) #> [1] TRUE later::run_now(1) #> [1] "/private/var/folders/38/lgkw9s3d5tn626g4z2r11bzm0000gp/T/RtmpFmlhtZ/watcher-example/newfile"  w$stop() unlink(dir, recursive = TRUE, force = TRUE)

title: Watch a Filesystem Location — watcher
text: Watcher R6 class following methods: $start() starts background monitoring. Returns logical TRUE upon success, FALSE otherwise. $stop() stops background monitoring. Returns logical TRUE upon success, FALSE otherwise. $get_path() returns watched path character string. $is_running() returns logical TRUE FALSE depending whether monitor running.
